p:
Previous studies have suggested changes in morphology and/or composition as the origin of enhanced catalytic activity in TMDCs. For example, prior work on the metallic polymorph of TaS 2 attributed the improvement of the overpotential value after 5000 cyclic voltammetry cycles to substantial morphological changes after the cycling process
5 . To test whether any morphological changes were occurring in our case; we collected scanning electron microscopy (SEM) images of the material both before and after cycling. Fig. 3c shows that the microcrystalline morphology is preserved after cycling. Furthermore, EDX mapping after cycling shows Mo and Te to be well distributed throughout the material (Supplementary Fig. 18).
